fine_kit.name: Fine Kit
fine_kit.description: Pick one: Medic, Climbing, Cooking, Repair, Soldier’s, or Wrecking.

artisan.name: Artisan
artisan.description: You can have up to 4 rig.

heavy.name: Heavy
heavy.action: Anchor is an action that Heavies specialize and train in. Unlike most actions it’s not rolled, but its rating determines its uses per mission. While on a mission, you may spend anchor uses to fight as a small group. This means you can face groups of lesser undead without loss of effect.
heavy.advancement:
At the end of each mission, mark 1 xp (playbook or attribute)...

  • When you roll a desperate action, mark 1 xp in that action’s attribute.
  • If you survived the mission.
  • If you helped your squad through might or fortitude.
  • If you brought into play your heritage or traumas (2 xp if you did both).
  • Per threat of the highest threat opponent on the mission.

medic.name: Medic
medic.action: Doctor is an action that Medics specialize and train in. Unlike most actions it’s not rolled, but its rating determines its uses per mission. While on a mission, you may spend doctor uses to treat a fellow Legionnaire so they ignore all wound penalties for a scene. Level 4 harm is still lethal.
medic.advancement:
At the end of each mission, mark 1 xp (playbook or attribute)...

  • When you roll a desperate action, mark 1 xp in that action’s attribute.
  • If you survived the mission.
  • If you helped your squad through medical knowledge or emotional comfort.
  • If you brought into play your heritage or traumas (2 xp if you did both).
  • Per threat of the highest threat opponent on the mission.

officer.name: Officer
officer.action: Channels is an action that Officers specialize in. Unlike most actions it’s not rolled, but its rating determines its uses per mission. You may spend channels uses to acquire an asset for your squad in a flashback. Roll sway to determine quality. You can spend additional uses to improve the quality as per supply rules. Such assets are temporary or "on loan" and will go away when the mission ends.
officer.advancement:
At the end of each mission, mark 1 xp (playbook or attribute)...

  • When you roll a desperate action, mark 1 xp in that action’s attribute.
  • If you survived the mission.
  • If you helped your squad through enforcing discipline or strategic planning.
  • If you brought into play your heritage or traumas (2 xp if you did both).
  • Per threat of the highest threat opponent on the mission.

scout.name: Scout
scout.action: Scrounge is an action that Scouts specialize and train in. Unlike most actions it’s not rolled, but its rating determines its uses per mission. While on a mission, you may spend scrounge uses to find safe and secure shelter or one load worth of supplies for everyone in your squad.
scout.advancement:
At the end of each mission, mark 1 xp (playbook or attribute)...

  • When you roll a desperate action, mark 1 xp in that action’s attribute.
  • If you survived the mission.
  • If you helped your squad through stealth or foresight.
  • If you brought into play your heritage or traumas (2 xp if you did both).
  • Per threat of the highest threat opponent on the mission.

sniper.name: Sniper
sniper.action: Aim is an action that Snipers specialize and train in. Unlike most actions it’s not rolled, but its rating determines its uses per mission. While on a mission, you may spend aim uses to increase the effect level of a shot. This means you can sometimes take out large, dangerous enemies with a single bullet.
sniper.advancement:
At the end of each mission, mark 1 xp (playbook or attribute)...

  • When you roll a desperate action, mark 1 xp in that action’s attribute.
  • If you survived the mission.
  • If you helped your squad through keen observation or key shots.
  • If you brought into play your heritage or traumas (2 xp if you did both).
  • Per threat of the highest threat opponent on the mission.

rookie.name: Rookie
rookie.action: As a Rookie you don’t get a Specialist action of your own. You will get one (grit) when you advance and become a Soldier. You advance to Soldier by taking the Not a Rookie Anymore ability, and they must take this ability as their first playbook advance.
rookie.advancement:
At the end of each mission, mark 1 xp (playbook or attribute)...

  • When you roll a desperate action, mark 1 xp in that action’s attribute.
  • If you survived the mission.
  • If you helped your squad by staying out of the way or surviving despite the odds.
  • If you brought into play your heritage or traumas (2 xp if you did both).
  • Per threat of the highest threat opponent on the mission.

soldier.name: Soldier
soldier.action: Grit is an action that Soldiers specialize and train in. Unlike most actions it’s not rolled, but its rating determines its uses per mission. You may spend grit uses to add +2d to a resistance roll. The grit use must be spent before the roll. You may only spend 1 grit use this way per roll.
soldier.advancement:
At the end of each mission, mark 1 xp (playbook or attribute)...

  • When you roll a desperate action, mark 1 xp in that action’s attribute.
  • If you survived the mission.
  • If you helped your squad through courage or determination.
  • If you brought into play your heritage or traumas (2 xp if you did both).
  • Per threat of the highest threat opponent on the mission.
soldier.startup:
Initial skills: Maneuver: 1, Skirmish: 1, Consort: 1.
Will receive special ability: Grit: 1.
Could be promoted to a Specialist.

supplies.name: Supplies
supplies.description: Supply: Gain from mission rewards. Lose from mission penalties. If you lose supply and have none, lose 1 morale instead. Spend supply to boost campaign actions and to take additional campaign actions. You can keep a max of 3 supply +1 per Supply Cart (see Materiel) when advancing

bulwark.name: Bulwark
bulwark.description: You can spend anchor uses as special armor against consequences to a squad you are defending.

backup.name: Backup
backup.description: When you protect a squadmate, resist with +1d. When you assist someone, their pushes only cost 1 stress.

tenacious.name: Tenacious
tenacious.description: Penalties from harm are one level less severe (though level 4 harm is still fatal).

weaponmaster.name: Weaponmaster
weaponmaster.description: You’re known as a Weaponmaster even outside the Legion. When you push yourself, you also gain potency in melee combat.

war_machine.name: War Machine
war_machine.description: When you push yourself you can do one of the following: perform a feat of physical force that verges on the superhuman — reduce the threat level of all the enemies you’re facing by one.

vigorous.name: Vigorous
vigorous.description: When you check wounds during rest and recuperation, place one free check. When you take harm, clear 1 stress.

against_the_darkness.name: Against the Darkness
against_the_darkness.description: You and all squadmates that can see you gain +1d to resist fear and corruption.

attache.name: Attaché
attache.description: You may deploy on any mission, even outside the usual Specialist caps. Gain this ability for free when you become a Medic.

first_aid.name: First Aid
first_aid.description: You can spend 1 use of Tonics to remove appropriate level 1 harm from any one person on your mission.

not_today.name: Not Today
not_today.description: You can spend a doctor use on a Legionnaire who has taken level 4 harm on a mission, but you must do so quickly before they die. You treat them and reduce the wound to level 3 harm instead.

doctor_feelgood.name: Doctor Feelgood
doctor_feelgood.description: Spend 1 use of Tonics to grant one person potency for a physical action.

field_dressing.name: Field Dressing
field_dressing.description: At the end of a mission you may expend remaining doctor uses to add 1 check to a Legionnaire's level 2 or 3 harm, once per person.

chemist.name: Chemist
chemist.description:
You have training in Orite alchemical medicine. You may equip an Alchemical Bandolier on each mission.
Orite Medical Alchemy (see chemist ability)
  • Owlsight Oil: See in the dark (24h). Light sensitive.
  • Chembalm: Neutralizes most poisons and toxins.
  • Deep: Lets you hold your breath for a scene.
  • Rage Venom: Gain physical potency for a scene. You must make a resolve resist to avoid attacking friend and foe indiscriminately. Addictive.

moral_support.name: Moral Support
moral_support.description: You know how to keep troop spirits up. Once a mission, if you tell a funny, personal, or meaningful story when the squad is resting, anyone listening may clear 1 stress.

tactician.name: Tactician
tactician.description: You anticipate problems others would never see coming. When you lead a group action you may suffer at most 1 stress.

lead_from_the_front.name: Lead from the Front
lead_from_the_front.description: Whenever you lead a group action, improve scale up or down one level (for example: a small group counts as a medium group or an individual). If you lead a group action in combat, you may count multiple 6s from different rolls as a CRITICAL.

logistical_support.name: Logistical Support
logistical_support.description: channels uses can be spent to assist a squadmate. When you do this, they get an additional +1d. Tell us how your preparation or supplies help them against this threat or obstacle.

mission_first.name: Mission First
mission_first.description: Add the following to "at the end of mission" xp triggers: If anyone died under your command.

obedience.name: Obedience
obedience.description: An NPC squadmate sacrifices themselves, on your orders. They die, and absorb all the harm for you or another Specialist from one attack. Remember that the Legion takes -1 morale each time this occurs.

strategist.name: Strategist
strategist.description: You gain +1d to sway when acquiring assets for a mission via channels uses. You also get +1d to the engagement roll for a mission.

officer_school.name: Officer School
officer_school.description: You're well educated and know arcane esoterica. Gain +1d when gathering info through research and when resisting with insight.

ghost.name: Ghost
ghost.description: You can spend scrounge uses as special armor against traps or detection.

panther_like_grace.name: Panther-Like Grace
panther_like_grace.description: When you are quick and carrying no armor, any harm you take starts as 1 level lower.

like_the_wind.name: Like the Wind
like_the_wind.description: Whenever there's a question of who goes first, the answer is you. Also take +1d when resisting attacks with prowess.

infiltrator.name: Infiltrator
infiltrator.description: When you gather info through clandestine observation, or attempt to bypass traps and security measures, gain potency.

sixth_sense.name: Sixth Sense
sixth_sense.description: You just know when there are undead nearby. You always know what the highest threat level of undead is in the area. You can gather info on them with resolve.

ready_for_anything.name: Ready for Anything
ready_for_anything.description: When being ambushed, your flashbacks cost 0 stress and you gain potency to all actions during those flashbacks. You also take 1 less level of harm on secondary missions.

daredevil.name: Daredevil
daredevil.description: When you make a desperate roll, gain +1d.

one_eye.name: One Eye
one_eye.description: You've replaced an eye with an alchemical construct. You can see invisible targets clearly and identify supernatural forces.

ambush.name: Ambush
ambush.description: When you attack from hiding or spring a trap, you get +1d.

akimbo.name: Akimbo
akimbo.description: When dueling at close range with two pistols, gain potency.

notches.name: Notches
notches.description: If you land the killing blow on a threat 2 or higher opponent, mark 1 xp in any category.

sharpshooter.name: Sharpshooter
sharpshooter.description: You can push yourself to do one of the following: make a ranged attack at extreme distance beyond what's normal for the weapon — unleash a barrage of rapid fire to suppress the enemy.

cover_fire.name: Cover Fire
cover_fire.description: If you set up someone with shoot or provide covering fire, they gain potency on their next action.

crimson_shot.name: Crimson Shot
crimson_shot.description: You're authorized to bring one Crimson Seeker shell on missions. Firing it counts as a threat 4 attack, and you must mark a trauma.

devil's_own_luck.name: Devil’s Own Luck
devil's_own_luck.description: You gain +1d to all resistance rolls. This ability cannot be taken as a Veteran advance.

every_inch_a.name: Every Inch a...
every_inch_a.description: You start with all the traits from your heritage. If taken as a Veteran advance, it must be the first ability selected at character creation.

hard_knocks.name: Hard Knocks
hard_knocks.description: Mark 2 xp in any category at the end of any mission where you took level 2 harm or higher. This ability cannot be taken as a Veteran advance.

just_a_kid.name: Just a Kid
just_a_kid.description: When someone suffers harm when protecting you, they mark xp. When you promote, choose a second special ability from your new playbook to replace this one. This ability cannot be taken as a Veteran advance.

gotta_make_it_out_alive.name: Gotta Make it out Alive
gotta_make_it_out_alive.description: You can take 1 additional trauma before dying. When you promote, replace this ability with a level of Survivor. This ability cannot be taken as a Veteran advance.

home_cooking.name: Home Cooking
home_cooking.description: If a mission takes multiple days, use your Fresh Food. Say what you cook. Everyone in the squad that partakes clears 1 stress. This ability cannot be taken as a Veteran advance.

jack_of_all_trades.name: Jack of all Trades
jack_of_all_trades.description: Increase 2 zero-ranked skills to rank 1. This ability cannot be taken as a Veteran advance.

not_a_rookie_anymore.name: Not a Rookie Anymore
not_a_rookie_anymore.description: You are promoted! You become a Soldier. Gain 1 special ability and 1 rank of Grit. You must take this as your first playbook advance. This ability cannot be taken as a Veteran advance or a starting ability.

relentless.name: Relentless
relentless.description: You may spend grit uses to push yourself.

over_the_top.name: Over the Top
over_the_top.description: When you charge into the teeth of an enemy that outnumbers or outguns you, clear 1 stress and take +1d to maneuver.

iron_will.name: Iron Will
iron_will.description: You can spend grit uses as special armor vs. fear, paralysis, corruption, and fatigue.

loaded_for_bear.name: Loaded for Bear
loaded_for_bear.description: When selecting load, you may select 4 utility load instead of 2.

eat_iron_shit_nails.name: Eat Iron, Shit Nails
eat_iron_shit_nails.description: When you push yourself, you may ignore all harm penalties. Also take +1d to resist the consequence of any roll you pushed yourself on.

grenadier.name: Grenadier
grenadier.description: You have explosives training and can always bring a grenade (1 load) or explosive charges (2 load) as part of your light load.

cavalry.name: Cavalry
cavalry.description: If the Quartermaster has Horses uses available, all members of your squad start missions with mounts. You gain +1d to maneuver while mounted.

specialist_training.name: Specialist Training
specialist_training.description: You promote to a Specialist. Make a new playbook: mark 1 special ability and a rank of the consequence of starting Specialist action.

elite.name: Elite
elite.description: Gain mastery of 2 actions (they can go up to rank 4).

hardened.name: Hardened
hardened.description: You can mark 2 additional stress boxes.

survivor.name: Survivor
survivor.description: You can take +1 trauma before dying.

veteran.name: Veteran
veteran.description: Take a special ability from another source.

ghost_owls.name: Ghost Owls
ghost_owls.description: When the Legion needs problems dealt with quickly and quietly, they send the Owls. They’re traditionally stocked with Legionnaires experienced as special operatives, trained in infiltrations and extractions. A little known fact is that their squad motto is an imperative, to always remain calm regardless of the situation. Many Legion Snipers and Scouts were once Owls.

ember_wolves.name: Ember Wolves
ember_wolves.description: The vanguard of the Legion, the Ember Wolves are the first unit sent into battle as shock troops. They charge head-on into danger, throwing the enemy into disarray and giving the rest of the Legion the chance to advance. Founded long ago by a seasoned Zemyati woman nicknamed the “Bloody Wolf,” they are known for volunteering to go where battle is the toughest.

grinning_ravens.name: Grinning Ravens
grinning_ravens.description: The backbone of the Legion and traditionally the most numerous squad, the Ravens are a second wave formation. They follow in the wake of the Ember Wolves, overtaking positions and holding against all odds. Their original founder was known for her famous spear, and the habit of laughing mid-battle when the odds were at their worst.

shattered_lions.name: Shattered Lions
shattered_lions.description: An elite unit of the Legion. They were the first unit ever formed, and once served as the personal guard to Emperor Tantarus as the Crimson Lions. When the Legion was shattered down to a handful, they rescued the Annals and reformed as the Shattered Lions. Bearers of the Legion’s standard, many Commanders and Marshals are veterans of this unit.

silver_stags.name: Silver Stags
silver_stags.description: Formed less than a hundred years ago, the Silver Stags have become the Legion’s rear guard. The squad was comissioned after a handful of Legionnaires held a town against a vastly superior force, surviving on rats and shoe-leather. Their leader afterwards requested his own command. They are often sent on missions where the line absolutely cannot fall, or hard choices must be made.

star_vipers.name: Star Vipers
star_vipers.description: The Legion has tangled with Great Beasts, fought alongside multiple Chosen, and faced incredible odds throughout the years. The Vipers are the ones who test and use strange alchemy and new weapons, and are trained to handle, research, and face the supernatural. They’ve sacrificed much over the years, and attract some eclectic individuals.

limited.controlled: You hesitate. Withdraw and try a different approach, or else do it with a minor consequence: a minor complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you suffer lesser harm, you end up in a risky position.
limited.risky: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer harm, a complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you end up in a desperate position.
limited.desperate: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you have reduced effect.

zero.controlled: You falter. Press on by seizing a risky opportunity, or withdraw and try a different approach.
zero.risky: Things go badly. You suffer harm, a complication occurs, you end up in a desperate position, you lose this opportunity.
zero.desperate: It’s the worst outcome. You suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you lose this opportunity for action.

resist.description: You reduce or completely avoid the effects of the consequences (GM choice).

results.common: Take Stress equal to 6 minus the highest (or lowest in case of a 0d roll) die result, which should be

questions.loyal: Are all on the mission oathsworn to the Legion?
questions.intel_spent: Did the Commander spend 1 intel to give you foresight and info?
questions.no_rookies: Is everyone on the mission a Specialist or Soldier?
questions.any_rebels: Does any Legionnaire distrust the leadership or not fear them enough to obey orders on the battlefield?

questions.positive: Did the Quartermaster equip the soldiers with Black Shot?
questions.negative: Is any Legionnaire starting the mission wounded?

questions.positive: Did the Quartermaster spend Horses to equip the mission?
questions.negative: Is any Legionnaire starting with heavy load?

questions.positive: Did the Quartermaster send Religious Supplies to ward and protect the Legionnaires?
Did the Quartermaster spend Food to equip the mission?
